text:
5%ABV. Lambic.

Poured out light amber brown. 18SRM.

Nose has grape soda and fresh boile barley aromas. The fruity aromas bloom a little more as itÂ’s allowed to breathe. Straight out of the bottle, the predominant aroma was that of freshly boiled barley water. The aroma of sweet ume and just ripening plums starts to come to the fore as it sits at room temperature.

Mouthfeel is juicy. Palate has nice clean barley flavors which you pick up at the end with a sweet clean flavor with a hint of starch. Front end is juicy with the sour and sweet of ripe ume and just ripening plums and cherries come up quite nicely. No obvious hops.

The finish is clean and predominantly that of fresh boiled barley grains.

Overall in the nose and in the palate, sweet and sour are balanced perfectly for a very pleasing fruity sour ale experience. Likely one of the most approachable spontans ever.

Goes on Favorites List!

Bottle: Poured a murky brown color beer with a light dirty bubbly head with light retention and some minimal lacing. Aroma of candi sugar with some funky notes. Taste is a mix of weird funky notes with not much tart notes and quite a bit of residual sugar notes. Body is full with medium carbonation. A bit weird and lacking some balance.

Appearance: golden, hazy, rocky head, white foam, mostly disappears fast. Aroma: apple, mold, bread. Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, medium sourness, tastes like nostalgic kosmis marmalade ðŸ˜œ. Palate: medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, no aftertaste.
Hazy amber liquid with white head. Aroma of sugar, earthy, marmelade. Tastes same, cider, medium sweet, medium sour. Medium body, light feel, soft carb.
LÂ’horreur porte un nom: Mikkeller Spontanfaro. AprÃ¨s ces dÃ©plaisantes arÃ´mes de jus de fromage bleu, ma bouche se fait agresser par un sucre aussi dÃ©goÃ»tant que laid. Moche moche moche.

Bottle. An unclear amber colored beer with a finger-thick beige head. Strange but sort of pleasant aroma with honey, dark rye bread, grass and a funky touch. ItÂ’s quite sweet on the palate, with an underlying lemony acidity and some bread, caramel and cellar. Not as much honey as in the aroma. ItÂ’s nicely carbonated, smooth and sweet on the palate, with a sweet, honey-ish finish with a bready touch. Nice, but strange. Too sweet and honey-ish, but still acidic and sour. DonÂ’t think I couldÂ’ve had much of this. 170516

Bottle. Pours bronze with an off-white head. Aroma of rye bread, slight honey comb, brown sugar and malt. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some malt, brown sugar, raisins and some sour notes. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 375ml @ geokkjer
Pours hazy orange with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, light tart, fruity, funky, bread and caramel, Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long sweet, caramel, funky and fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

25.04.2017, 0,375l bottle @ home:
Nice fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet sour-ish, old rope, grain, soda powder, grass, sugar, wet hay, hints of caramel and old cellar. Taste is slightly sweet sour-ish, soda powder, minerals, sugar, sour winegum, grass, grain, old rope, citrus acid. Medium bitterness, slightly grainy and sour-ish mineraly mouthfeel. Fair enough.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupeÅ‚niania profilu na ratebeer. Å»elazista, przesÅ‚odzona herbata :(

0,375l bottle at home. BB 02/06/2020. amber clear color, rather big off-white head. smells parfumy, ripe fruits, tobacco, chlorophyl, light grape notes, sewage. ok smell. medium body, soft carbonation, rather sticky moutfheel. tastes sweet, ripe fruits, some sweet herbs, grapes. finishes light to medium sweet with notes of ripe fruits, grapes and sweet herbs. actually taste is rather nice but quite on the sweet side, smell wasnt that pleasant though. overall definitly a drinkable faro (if you dont mind sweet beers).

375ml bottle @El LÃºpulo Feroz, Oviedo. 19-02-2017.
BBD:06-2020.
Pours hazy copper with some off white head. Moderate head retention, poor lacing. Strong dried fruits nose, raisins, plums, licorice, caramel. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is really sweet, almost cloying, little to almost no sour notes. Barley wine nose, poor lambic character.

Pours a pretty clear altough a bit dark brown-ish golden with a medium slightly off-white head that leaves pretty nice lacing. Nose is of syrupy sugar over a pretty recognizable lambic base. Taste is moderately sweet (itÂ’s a faro, remember?) and lightly tart. Brown sugar. Caramel apples. Body is moderately light and carbonation moderate. A bit sticky on the lips. All in all a tasty faro that is sweet but certainly not as much as the mass-produced ones. Would I get this again? Probably not (IÂ’m a ticker more than a faro fan) but for now it is pretty enjoyable!

bottle. orange murky shitty coloured. old malty, light sweety nose. not really appealing. med bodied, old oxidized malty flavour, light molassy syrupy. a real let-down. feels like the worst kind of bulk higher-abv lager mixed with a little syrup. the faro tick is the only thing keeping me from crumbling, knowing I probably paid close to 10Â€ for this disaster.

375 ml bottle poured at home. Pours a cloudy muddy colour, like iced tea mix with a white head. Smells sour. Tastes cloyingly sweet with a sour finish. It is too sweet...ruined it for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat. Pours very dark golden, light hazy with a big creamy white head. Light sweet and tarty aroma. Taste is sweet, yellow plums and caramel, weak tart finish, a tad too sweet for my likings

25-FEB-2017, bottle @home, brought by Morten. Thx. :-)
Hazy orange with a lasting, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma is cheese!
Taste is cheese, Brown sugar, bread, funk, orange, bisquit. Sweet, slightly tart, creamy.

37,5 cl bottle @ lusikka, BBE 02.06.2020
Aroma is odd with earthy notes, sourness, grapefruit and bretta. Flavour has some sugar, earthy notes, bretta, fruitiness and mild grapefruit tones. A bit messy but interesting anyway.

375 ml bottle. 02.06.2020. Thanks lusikka!
Pours hazy golden color with a small head. Sugary sweet aroma, ripe fruits, honey, caramel and toffee, some grapes. Flavor is sweet toffee and ripe fruits, some starch. Quite sweet, not very drinkable.
6323

375 ml bottle. Pours a dark golden colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of sweet tangerine, sugar and herbal notes. Flavour of sweet sugar, citrusy notes, wet earth and vinegar notes. Medium bodied. Harsh carbonation. Very, very sweet even for a faro.

375ml bottle. Pours dark orange with a smooth head. Aroma of tartish notes, earthiness, mild sourness, hints of syrup and berries. Taste is sweet, sugary and slightly earthy with loads of caramel, hints of earthiness. Finish is sweet, slightly watery and slightly tartish with loads of caramel, hints of sourness and earthy notes. Too sweet for my taste.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear golden blond beer with no carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: sweet candy and sourness, alcohol notes. Candied fruits. Taste: medium body with sweet candy and sourness notes. Candied fruits as apricot and raisin/plums. Sweet, not well balanced. Aftertaste: sweet candy and sourness.
Bottle. Hazy amber color. Aroma: apples, a little wildly and sour, spicy. Taste: apple, sweet and sour, candy.

Flaska bestÃ¤lld frÃ¥n Brewdog. Disigt mÃ¶rkorange med vitt skum. Dov doft av aprikos och torkad frukt. SÃ¶t och fruktig, aprikos och persika .

Piana wysoka, acz nie ma co siÄ™ do niej przyzwyczajaÄ‡. Aromat raczej niewyraÅºny - sporo cukru kandyzowanego, akcent dziki jest raczej maÅ‚o odczuwalny. Ujawnia siÄ™ w caÅ‚ej swojej krasie dopiero po jakimÅ› czasie, chociaÅ¼ raczej w formie dusznego aromatu potu, niestety. W smaku balans pomiÄ™dzy sÅ‚odyczÄ… a kwaskiem idzie jednak w stronÄ™ tego pierwszego. Przez agresywne nalewanie trochÄ™ mi siÄ™ rozgazowaÅ‚o. Brakuje mu wyrazu, choÄ‡ nie da siÄ™ ukryÄ‡, Å¼e pije siÄ™ to szybko i smacznie.

Aus der Flasche getrunken (aus dem Mikkeller-Weihnachtskalender). Dunkelamber mit wunderbar feinporiger, stabiler weiÃŸer Schaumkrone. In der Nase etwas fruchtig-mufflig. Interessante SÃ¼ÃŸe Ã¼berlagert die SÃ¤ure. Etwas klebrig an den Lippen

Bottle @ home. Aroma of candy sugar, light metallic in aroma from the sugar. Clear brown with white head, mostly diminishing. Taste is moderate sweet and light+ sour. Medium body, watery+ feel and sweet finish.

Bottle thanks to Nikos. Now at at least seven of every style! Pours fairly hazy Amber, medium beige head, decent lacing. Aroma is, oh god it smells like a middle eastern NA wort bomb. Grain and sugar. Flavor is about the same actually. Quite sweet, worty, brown sugar, grain. All lambic nuance lost under the sledgehammer over the head sugar. Medium body. At least it tastes better than it smells. Not my thing.

Huge thanks to Leighton for bringing this across the pond for me help me. Was saving this brew but as always I ran out of beer so here we go. At least for moment I am now at 10 of every style! Pours murky reddish brown small head. Nose is citrus, Apple, brown sugar. Tastes of tart lemons, Apple, brown sugar, caramel, some pie dough. Semi tart and pretty sweet. Odd but very glad I have tried.
Light amber coloured and hazy. Has an almost Â´white head, Heavy sweet aroma and flavor, faint acidic, no bitterness. Sugars. Acidic and rubarb.
heavy sweet aroma,amber, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly sour, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,
Bottle. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Light malty and hoppy not that sour aroma. MOderate sweet and light bitter and very light sour flavor. Average finish. Oily palate.

Bottle shared at Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2016, Day 2.
Near clear amber with a small white head. Aroma of light funk, a little wood and brown sugar. Flavour is above moderate sweet and light moderate sour. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
[20-08-2016]

26th October 2016Bright clear amber beer, good cream colour head. Palate is light and mildly dry, reasonable fine carbonation. Mildly sour generic fruits, little sweet cherry and a touch of Dr Pepper. This all sits in a pretty sweet backdrop. A light dry finish. The balance of sweet and sour is a bit given over to the sweet, but itÂ’s fine.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2016 Aroma: sugar, dough, some fruits
Taste: medium sweet, light sour, brown sugar, dough

Pours dark, rather unclear amber. Small white head. Smell is sweet, no sourness left. Taste is sweet , no sourness left. Meh. Not a true faro. Choo Choo goes the hype train thoguh. Bottle even states thereÂ’s added yeast. If yeast is added, it canÂ’t be a lambic, ergo, it canÂ’t be a faro. Stop fuckinÂ’ with us Mikkel !

375ml bottle from the Brewdog Online Shop, shared with jeevan. Pours clear dark gold with a thin white head. Aromas of sweet sugars, wood, faint acetic sour note. Taste is fruity, sweet, oak and sour. Sweet finish.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty weak sour woody aroma. Fruity malty spicy sweet woody sour flavor. Has a fruity woody sour sweetish woody finish.

Pours an almost clear amber with a large frothy white head. Aromas of damp cellar, farmhouse, ripe apple, caramel, oak, musky notes. Taste is earthy with tones of overripe apple and slight banana. Mouthfeel is surprisingly smooth with a light body and medium carbonation.

Bottle from Warszawski Festiwal Piwa. Aroma: Sweet, peach, lemon, toffee, sauerkraut. Appearance: Amber hazy colour, no head. Taste: Sweet, candy sugar, fruity, peaches, lemons, light quince, agave, light wood, sourness very light. Palate: Body is medium, finish is sweet, carbonation medium.

Bottle to tulip
Consummation: Sour brown sugar and diacetyl...infected? :(
Adjunct: Sour diacetyl aroma; amber, bright white head, nice lacing

September 2016 - Bottle share at One Canada Square, as Â’Mikkeller SpontanfaroÂ’. With thanks to Colin. Translucent dark amber, still, foamy white head, light lacing. Aroma is sugary, toffee, honey, agave nectar. Body is light, tingly carbonation, smooth. Taste is, again, sugary, demerara, honey, more sugar. Very sweet with very little of anything else. True to style, I suppose. But youÂ’d expect a bit more if youÂ’re going to fork out for a bottle to yourself. You can pick up a similar faro for Â€0.50 on the continent. (3.2)
37.5 cL bottle. Pours almost clear brown to greyish. Small fizzy almost white head. Aroma is sweet candy and metallic. Sweet, grainy and metallic flavoured. Lingering sweet and grainy finish.

375ml bottle (thanks Mart). Clear deep amber color. Small size, white head, stays. Acidic, fruity, lemon, pineapple, peach, minerals in aroma. Sweet, peach, sugary, lemon in taste. Lemon and sugar in aftertaste. Crisp mouthfeel. Drinkable brew.
Bottle (from mikkeller webshop). Pours amber. Aroma is sweet, candy, caramel. Flavor is sweet and sour, candy, caramel, wheat, some artificial lemon. Finish has more candy. Overall: ok.

Bottle shared by Mart, thanks! Hazy orange amber beer, white head. Nose is sweet and sugary, malts, fruity notes and wood. Flavor is sweet yet tart, sugar, dry notes, some lemon, some caramel. Lingering malt and lemon notes.

37.5cl bottle via Bottle Shoo Bermondsey. It pours a dark copper color with a medium off white head. Aroma is sweet and malty with light tangy lemon juice notes. Taste is also sweet malty with notes of caramel and biscuit and and a light tangy acidic notes of lemon and funk. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, meh

375 ml bottle poured in to a Flute. BBE June 2020. Hazy, amber-golden colour with a creamy, off-white head. Sweet aroma with caramel malts, sugars, subtle tart fruity notes, wooden hints and citrus. Taste is sweet-sour. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes slightly sour with tart fruits and a surgery sweetness. Okay made Faro.

375ml bottle @ MTG II tasting at RichÂ’s Welfare Pad. Probably shouldnÂ’t rate this given the amount I salvaged from the bottle, but well... Pours what appears to be a typically faro golden amber with a light haze. Aroma is sweet brown sugar. Taste is sweet, sugary with dark fruits and a low carbonation.
Keg at BrewDog Birmingham; hazy brown pour with a thin white head, aroma has brown sugar, taste has sweet brown sugar, sour lemon, sweet caramel, bready malts.
Bottle thanks to richthevillan, cheers Rich. Amber beer with small head. Aroma of caramel, malts and some wine notes. Taste is sweet, fruity, malts, sugar and a touch tangy. Good stuff.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Bottle split at Level 42, from CPH Kioskh, 07/09/16.
Very light haze on a golden amber pour with a decent off white head.
Nose is pissy, lemon curd, bread, yeast, light sugar.
Taste comprises grains, sweet notes, paper, lemon, citric rinds, bread, vanilla, light tarte fruits, hay.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a light tarte scrub.
Ok for style.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at the level 42 tasting 7/9/2016. Many thanks to cloin for this one. A dull, amber orange coloured pour, with a sticky white head, Aroma is big sweet brown bread, sugars, apple, musty, grape. Flavour is composed of sweet malts, brown sugars, apple, light funk, apple, . Palate is medium sweet stale grains, lowish carbonation. Not a massive fan. What is the point in a faro.

Bottle shared inlonson - thanks to Cloine. Pours clear, deep gold with a creamy, off-white head. Bready malts in the nose, some ripe citrus, ripe lemon. Light sweet flavour with low acidity, sugary bread, nips of melon and tangerine. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Sugary finish, with suggestions of berries, tangerine, simple bread. Simple and sugary.

Bottle thanks to Colin. It pours clear amber with a medium white head. The aroma is earthy, musty, funky, mild sweetness, caramel, apple and pear. The taste is crisp, sweet - sweet, tangy, apple, pear, sherbet, candied fruits, apricot and green apple finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Decent for the style.

375ml bottle pours a pale amber color with a finger and a half of off-white head that leaves some spotted lacing on the glass. Aroma is brown sugar and malts with some hints of lemon. Taste is light lemon tartness and malty sweetness that lingers long on the tongue. Light bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, this brew is quite sweet for the style, but interesting enough.

Bottle 375ml. @ The Danish (Ulfborg) Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2016, TNO(U)DRBSG16 @ fonefan & Brugmasia House. [ As Mikkeller Spontanfaro ].Clear medium amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, hay, straw, sweet brown sugar, tart, farmyard - bread. Flavor is moderate sweet with a long duration, sugar, sweet malt, tart notes. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160820]
Bottle @ home. Bronze pour with a small head. Notes of light funk, some sweet apples, brown sugar, light lemon and some cheese.

Bottle at a tasting. Decidedly sugary, caramelly. Light to moderate grassy resiny hoppiness, slightly lemony. Sourness is light and very very clean, almost too clean for me to believe it naturally developed. Easy drinking but that is about its biggest virtue.
Bottle. Orange color, thick white head. Aroma of caramel malt, citrus hops. Taste is medium sweet, light sour, lot of caramel  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Bottle from 100 piv. Amber color with thick white head. Aroma of caramel, sugar. Very sweet taste with caramel, sugar, light sourness. Not my style.
Bo. Amber body with tan head. Aroma is wine some malts and hints of barnyard. Taste is sweet malts with some sourness. Aftertaste is sweet balanced by some sourness. Nice one.

Sampled from bottle @ Danish Ratebeer Gathering 2016, Ulfborg, Day 2. Clear orange golden color, average sized white head. Smell and taste some sweetness, a slight sweetish barnyard, sugar and some lemon / citrus. Hmm ok.

Aroma and taste is sweet with notes of fruit and malt, fruity grapeskin, grapes, fruity finish.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy amber with a head. Aroma is sweet, malty, dark sugar and light barnyard. Flavor is quite sweet and light acidic. Sweet finish. 200816
Bottle, 5%. Clear amber with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, bread and a little sour. Flavour is malt, bread, medium sweet, little brown sugar, little lemon and wood.
TNOD(U)RBSG16. Clear amber, small white head. Malty aroma, sweet caramel. Sweet flavour, light funk and some sourish notes underneath.

Bottled at TNOD(U)RBSG2016. Lightly hazy pale amber, small head. Aroma of sugar candy. Sweet with light lemony sourness medium bodied with clean mouthfeel. Dusty sugar, lemon juice and - not much more.

Sampled @ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2016, Saturday, Day 2


37.5cl bottle. Pours clear dark golden colour with a mid-sized good lasting white head. Aroma of sweet fruits, some apricot. Taste of sweet malt, grains, some wood and sugar.
SÃ¼ÃŸer, leicht fruchtiger Antrunk, der schnell im Nichts verschwindet. Malzigern noch moderat sÃ¼ÃŸer Mittelteil, im Anschluss leer. 10/7/8/7//7
Bottle @ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering, fonefan. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are brett, sugar, fruits, malt and hops. Sweet sugary and light sour finish.

Bottled. Pours slightly hazy and deep golden to amber with a small off-white head.  Aroma of brown sugar, wood and funky notes. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and a little tart. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. A nice Faro. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

Bottle. Pours golden with a pretty thin head. Aroma is sweet, a lot of sugar. Also sour, lemon. Quite flat, medium body. Sour finish. More sweet than sour in flavour, the sugar is very prominent. Sour is mostly in finish. TheyÂ’ve done better beers.
Bottle from Kihoskh. (thanks Eddan) Light amber with a small head. Very sweet with sugar, light wood and hints of malt. Unbalanced and a bit too much.
@ Scandic, MalmÃ¶ 16-8-11: Mycket sÃ¶t och sockrig. Saknar lite dimension. Blir bara sÃ¶tt

Bottle.
Clear Brown pour, small White head. 
Nose is slightly sour. Taste round, with a sweet&sour sort of finish. 
Pretty good.
Medium body, soft carbonation.
